      • MapboxNavigationOptions

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxTurnCompletionOffset

        public MapboxNavigationOptions setMaxTurnCompletionOffset(double maxTurnCompletionOffset)
        Set the threshold user must be within to count as completing a LegStep. When checking if the users completed the step, the users Location.getBearing() and the StepManeuver.bearingAfter are compared. If this number is within the setMaxTurnCompletionOffset the user has completed the step. This is one of the two heuristics used to know when a user completes a step, the other being NavigationConstants.MANEUVER_ZONE_RADIUS.
        Parameters:
        maxTurnCompletionOffset - degree double value between 0 and 359 representing the threshold used to consider if the user has completed the step maneuver.
        Returns:
        This.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • setManeuverZoneRadius

        public MapboxNavigationOptions setManeuverZoneRadius(double maneuverZoneRadius)
        Radius, in meters, the user must enter to count as completing a step. This is one of the two heuristics used to know when a user completes a step, the other being NavigationConstants.MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_DEGREE_OFFSET_FOR_TURN_COMPLETION
        Parameters:
        maneuverZoneRadius - double radius value with unit meters representing the area the user must enter to count as completing a step.
        Returns:
        This.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • setMaximumDistanceOffRoute

        public MapboxNavigationOptions setMaximumDistanceOffRoute(double maximumDistanceOffRoute)
        Maximum distance in meters a user can travel away from the step geometry before the OffRouteListener's called.
        Parameters:
        maximumDistanceOffRoute - double value in unit meters representing the maximum distance a user can travel before the OffRouteListener gets called.
        Returns:
        this.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • setDeadReckoningTimeInterval

        public MapboxNavigationOptions setDeadReckoningTimeInterval(double deadReckoningTimeInterval)
        When calculating whether or not the user is on the route, we look where the user will be given their speed and this deadReckoningTimeInterval variable.
        Parameters:
        deadReckoningTimeInterval - time interval in unit seconds we use for dead reckoning purposes.
        Returns:
        this.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • setMaxManipulatedCourseAngle

        public MapboxNavigationOptions setMaxManipulatedCourseAngle(double maxManipulatedCourseAngle)
        Maximum angle the user puck will be rotated when snapping the user's course to the route line.
        Parameters:
        maxManipulatedCourseAngle - degree int value between 0 and 359 representing the maximum angle the user puck will be rotated
        Returns:
        this.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • setDefaultMilestonesEnabled

        public void setDefaultMilestonesEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Will create a set of pre-defined Milestones for basic updates while navigating along a route.
        Parameters:
        enabled - - will create default milestones (default)
        Since:
        0.4.0

      • getMaxTurnCompletionOffset

        public double getMaxTurnCompletionOffset()
        Get the current set threshold user must be within to count as completing a LegStep. When checking if the user completed the step, the users StepManeuver.bearingAfter are compared. If this number is within the setMaxTurnCompletionOffset the user has completed the step. This is one of the two heuristics used to know when a user completes a step, the other being NavigationConstants.MANEUVER_ZONE_RADIUS.
        Returns:
        degree double value between 0 and 359 representing the threshold being used to consider if the user has completed the step maneuver.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • getManeuverZoneRadius

        public double getManeuverZoneRadius()
        Get the current radius, in meters, the user must enter to count as completing a step. This is one of the two heuristics used to know when a user completes a step, the other being NavigationConstants.MAXIMUM_ALLOWED_DEGREE_OFFSET_FOR_TURN_COMPLETION
        Returns:
        double radius value with unit meters representing the area the user must enter to count as completing a step.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • getMaximumDistanceOffRoute

        public double getMaximumDistanceOffRoute()
        Get the current required maximum distance in meters a user can travel away from the step geometry before the OffRouteListener's called.
        Returns:
        double value in unit meters representing the maximum distance a user can travel before the OffRouteListener gets called.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • getDeadReckoningTimeInterval

        public double getDeadReckoningTimeInterval()

        Since:
        0.2.0

      • getSecondsBeforeReroute

        public int getSecondsBeforeReroute()
        The seconds before off-route happens, initially when the user goes off-route, a timer is started and waits till it reaches this value and then notifies the off-route listener.
        Returns:
        seconds value before rerouting
        Since:
        0.3.0

      • setSecondsBeforeReroute

        public void setSecondsBeforeReroute(int secondsBeforeReroute)
        The seconds before off-route happens, initially when the user goes off-route, a timer is started and waits till it reaches this value and then notifies the off-route listener.
        Parameters:
        secondsBeforeReroute - seconds value before rerouting
        Since:
        0.3.0

      • setDirectionsProfile

        public void setDirectionsProfile(java.lang.String profile)
        Set the directions profile which will be used when requesting the route. It will also determine variables used to determine alert levels.
        Parameters:
        profile - one of the profiles defined in NavigationProfiles

      • getDirectionsProfile

        public java.lang.String getDirectionsProfile()
        Get the directions profile which will be used when requesting the route. It will also determine variables used to determine alert levels.
        Returns:
        one of the profiles defined in NavigationProfiles
        Since:
        0.3.0
